meaningMnemonic: When you <kanji>put</kanji> something you don't just put it, you have <vocabulary>to put down</vocabulary> this item or even <vocabulary>(to) set down</vocabulary> the item. Basically, you have to put something down with this verb. It's a little different from the kanji meaning you learned but not that different.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: Just imagine you're putting down <reading>O</reading>reos (お). One after another. Each oreo that you try <vocabulary>to put down</vocabulary> say in your head "Hello Mr. Oreo, I'm going to put you down.. ooh yes, you like that don't you?" REPEAT.
